verbose_text: The mdx mouse shows i) a loss of the sarcolemmal dystrophin isoform Dp427 and a drastic reduction in dystrophin associated glycoproteins in contractile cells; ii) elevated levels of serum creatine kinase indicative of reduced muscle fiber integrity; iii) a varying degree of muscle degeneration ranging from minimal effects in extraocular and laryngeal muscle to segmental necrosis in limb muscle to severe fiber wasting in diaphragm muscle; iv) a high susceptibility to osmotic shock or stretch induced injury; and v) abnormal calcium handling including elevated cytosolic Ca 2+ -levels.
